alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Holmes; Richland; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 11:10PM EDT until August 24 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Ashland County in north central Ohio... Richland County in north central Ohio... Holmes County in northeastern Ohio... Southern Wayne County in northeastern Ohio... * Until 515 AM EDT Thursday. * At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mansfield, Millersburg, Shelby, Berlin, Ontario, Lexington, Crestline, Loudonville, Bellville, Plymouth, Shreve, Hayesville, Holmesville, Mount Eaton, Nashville, Winesburg, Butler, Perrysville, Lucas and Fredericksburg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
